channel.title: How do you permanently mute someone?
channel.description: I don't know how to perm mute someone, meaning forever. I know how to mute for 48 hours but I don't want to do that, I want forever and I never thought I wouldn't know how to do this. Does anybody know?

item.title: How do you permanently mute someone?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Prima, post:2, topic:249173”]Declare:

public int playerMuted;

In ‘public boolean savemoreinfo()’:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-muted = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerMuted), 0, Integer.toString(playerMuted).length());

In ‘public int loadmoreinfo()’:

if (token.equals("character-muted")) { playerMuted = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

In ‘case 126:’ add:

if (playerMuted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot talk!"); }

Find:

case 4: // regular chat

In there add:

if (playerMuted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot talk!"); }

The command:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                    p.playerMuted = 1;
		p.savemoreinfo();
		sendMessage("You have muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sendMessage("Enter the name of a player you want to mute.");
            }
        }[/code][/quote]

Ok everything is in the right spots but I got this error: client.java:10470: <identifier> expected mutedate = 0; // date muted so they can be unmuted in 24 hours ^ 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

How do I fix that?

EDIT: I fixed it but never mind…I’m not using it. It didn’t work. It sent you a message that said you are muted but you could still talk. And whoever you use it on it deletes all of their “moreinfo” file so I’m not using it.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you permanently mute someone?

item.title: How do you permanently mute someone?
item.dc:creator: @Prima Prima
item.description:
@Prima wrote:

Declare:

public int playerMuted;

In ‘public boolean savemoreinfo()’:

characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-muted = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerMuted), 0, Integer.toString(playerMuted).length());

In ‘public int loadmoreinfo()’:

if (token.equals("character-muted")) { playerMuted = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

In ‘case 126:’ add:

if (playerMuted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot talk!"); }

Find:

case 4: // regular chat

In there add:

if (playerMuted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot talk!"); }

The command:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“mute”) && playerRights >= 2) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                    p.playerMuted = 1;
		p.savemoreinfo();
		sendMessage("You have muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                } else { 
                   sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sendMessage("Enter the name of a player you want to mute.");
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic
